YOU MUST KNOW YOUR STATE/LOCAL LAWS AND REGULATIONS REGARDING FIREARM AND AMMUNITION PURCHASES BEFORE YOU BUY/BID. Please get with your local FFL for more information. 

Payment
Precision Firearms accepts the following credit/debit cards: Visa, Master Card, Discover Card and Diners Club International. We will accept credit cards over the phone. We also accept personal checks, cashier checks, certified money orders and Paypal payments for non-firearm or ammunition related purchases only.

Shipping
All firearms sales are final and considered “AS IS” unless warranty is otherwise stated. We will ship weapons to any FFL in the continental United States for a flat rate fee of $20 for handguns and $30 for long guns. We will not ship firearms to individuals. Return Policy
Incorrect items: If a product is not the product that you ordered, Precision Firearms will either replace the product or give you a full refund if returned within 10 days of receipt. Precision Firearms cannot replace products that have been used, unless they are covered under the manufacturer's warranty, you will send these items directly to the manufacturer for replacement. Used Gun Purchase (Buy Back): At our discretion, we may offer to buy a firearm, at a price to be determined by Precision Firearms.

Electronic Devices, Hearing Protectors, Lasers, Rangefinders, Lights and other electronic devices are covered by the manufacturer, and must be returned to the manufacturer for repair or replacement. 
No refunds or returns are accepted on these types of items. We only carry Electronic Devices that are covered under warranty by a reputable manufacturer.
Please consult your owner’s manual for warranty information, or call us for instructions.

title: For Sale:  S&W Model 1
postcontent:
This is an 1860's Smith and Wesson Model 1 in .22 caliber made by Rollin White. Some of the original bluing is still present on this gun. The rosewood grips still have much of their original varnish! 

This is a 1st issue, with only 12,000 produced with a serial number of 3648
After the Smith & Wesson revolver came on the market, Rolland White began production of a revolver of his own in 1861 in a factory in Lowell, Massachusetts called "Rollin White Arms Company". Approximately 4300 revolvers were made under Rollin White Arms, most of which were sold to Smith & Wesson to keep up with demand.

This is a real classic piece of post civil war history. Asking price is OBO so please do not hesitate to shoot me an offer! I DO know exactly what I have here and I know how much I could potentially get for it with the right buyer, so please, no low balling! Serious inquiries only! This is a family heirloom, so I am not hard pressed to get rid of it!   

Gun is bluebooked from $2500-8000

title: For Sale:  CONCEALED HANDGUN LICENSE FAST ONLINE?
postcontent:
Be aware that to get your Virginia license, you must first have a license from your home state.  Otherwise it is nothing more than a piece of plastic.  This is a very deceptive ad.

"Any person who is at least 21 years of age, who is not a Wisconsin resident, and who holds a valid concealed carry license issued by any of the states on DOJ’s list will be recognized in Wisconsin as an out-of-state licensee, per s. 175.60 (1)(g)."

A Wisconsin resident must have a Wisconsin concealed carry license in order to carry in Wisconsin, even if that individual holds a valid concealed carry license from another state.

New in 2010, the Model 92A1 represents Beretta’s evolution of the world famous 92FS pistol. Combining the best elements of the 92FS and the 90-Two,these pistols feature:

These accessory pockets will bolt to the front of the ESEE-5 and ESEE-6 hard sheath by aligning the holes in the pocket with the holes in the sheath and using the provided 4 screws and posts to securely tighten the sheath and pocket together. title: For Sale:  CRIMSON TRACE grips for compact 1911    like new
postcontent:
These are Crimson Trace LG 404 (compact 1911) laser grips.  I had them on my little Kimber Ultra before I sold it.  The buyer didn't understand the utility of laser grips on those little guns!  

I can't overstate the value of being able to put the red dot where you want it without raising your arm or taking eyes off the target.  At 5 to 20 yards, you know the problem is not with the little gun; They're consistent and put the bullet where they are aimed. Having the red dot (except on a bright sunny day, of course) helps the user tremendously.

I've kept these grips, thinking I'll get another ultra, compact or officer's model .45, but now it looks like that is not in the cards.  

These grips are about 18 months old;  I had them on my gun for about 6 months.  Everything that came with the grips when new is still in the box.  I will include the original batteries  --  which still seem to be great to me  --  and a brand new set for your future use.  The batteries last for years in the grips, and the new set have a suggested 'use by' date of 2017.

I've had other laser grips that look like Crimson Trace, and they may even say "laser grips" on the bottom like some models of Crimson Trace.  In a side by side comparison, it's clear that the knock offs are not as bright or focused.  You will never be sorry you paid for the quality of the best name brand. 

If you see this listing, the grips are available; I'll deactivate this when they're gone.

title: For Sale:  Browning A5 Light Twelve
postcontent:
1950 Belgium-made Light Twelve, it shoots and cycles 2 3/4" shells beautifully but has a age-related issues. I shot it last week and had forgotten how light the recoil is!
This is not in perfect shape, so it's not priced like it. There's no choke, as the original PolyChoke came off several years ago. There's a couple small rust spots on the barrel but they're not spreading and you could re-blue the barrelif they bother you. The bluing on the receiver is still very good. The forearm has a hairline crack on it which is not spreading/changing, which is apparently very common on the old A5s.

This gun also has a unique safety which is located in front of the gold trigger. Browning switched to a different safety a few years later, adding to the uniqueness of this firearm. There's a switch on the side of the receiver that allows you to block the magazine from feeding so you can quickly load a different type of round.
This gun would be great for self-defense or you could add a choke for hunting/clays.

Cash only, face-to-face. Can meet in Appleton or Green Bay. I'm looking at getting a Mosin Nagant or 22 handgun and would consider trade + cash.

title: For Sale:  P.Beretta AL2 20ga semi auto Like New
postcontent:
A fine Italian made P.Beretta semi-auto 20 gauge shotgun has a 26 inch, vent rib, improved cylinder barrel.  This  model was made from 1969 - 1976.  This weapon is marked Garcia Sporting Arms, Washington D.C., the company that imported for P.Beretta from Italy from 1973 - 1975 before the creation of Beretta USA.  Most of the Garcia imported AL2 20 ga had a "Browning" marked barrels, this barrel is marked P.Beretta, made in Italy.

 In both the AL1 & the AL2 the 20 gauge was produced in far lower numbers than the 12 gauge.  The AL1 has machine engraving, the AL2 is hand engraved,with the gold plated trigger.

I got this beauty in a trade.  I am more of a handgun guy, so this Beretta is looking for a new home.  The weapon can be picked up in Dublin, Ohio or mailed to your FFL at your expense.

Due to the dynamic changes in the modern battlefield, the threats of global terrorism and the demands of ever-changing combat situations, there was a need for a new versatile, innovative and technologically advanced weapon.

Bull pup configuration.

Designed for Minimum operator and armorer level maintenance, thus reducing maintenance and life cycle costs.
Folding back-up sights that include tritium for night combat.
Very easy field striping into 2 parts.
100% interchangeability with parts of the Tavor family, thus reducing the overall costs of the system.
Equipped with a last round stopper.
All the metal parts of the weapon are corrosion resistant.
Recoil absorbent butt pad for rifle grenade firing.

• Increases hit probability under fatigue and pressure.

title: For Sale:  Remington 700 ADL.222 Rem Mag Like New:
postcontent:
Simply beautiful Remington 700 ADL rifle with a perfect bore, could be unfired.  The rear sight is missing.  It has a EK barrel date, thus manufactured in November, 1963.

The .222 Rem Mag was developed in 1958 by Remington in competition for a new, light rifle round for the US Army,  the 5.56x45 won that contract.  Remington release the .222 Rem Mag to the public as a varmint rifle caliber, in 1961.  When 5.56x45 rifles started hitting the civilian market, Remington closely copied it and released the Rem .223 in 1964.  Remington stopped producing rifles in .222 Rem Mag in 1967.

This is a collector quality rifle, in excellent shape, in a caliber that was short lived.

Pick up in Dublin, Ohio, or sent to your FFL at your expense.

$850 obo

title: For Sale/Trade:  Colt Revolver Official Police .38 Mfg. 1944
postcontent:
Colt Official Police .38 Revolver      Mfg. 1944 with Holster  

Great Gun For Amateur Collectors 

On butt of gun has inscription of H.P.D.  no 901  

This is a used condition revolver....it still shoots great.  Still fully functional self defense weapon for male or female. 

I've shot it and cleaned it after wards, then it just got put up for 10 years, so I figured I'd see if anyone else would have more use for it.  I do not have a box for it or any papers as I inherited it.  Just a leather holster that came with it.

It has wear on the grips, the left is better than the right one and holster wear.  The bluing is discolored.  Best to look at pics and see gun first hand.  Overall its in good shape for a gun from 1944. That's based on the serial number I looked up on Colts website and an independent website.

I've been watching them on gunbroker the past few months and they are listed anywhere from $425 for much worse condition up to $800 in better condition.  So I figured I'd split it down the middle and ask $650 obo cash or open to trade offers for something I can use for home defense or fun with the kids.  Make me reasonable offer, worst I can say is no thank you.  I'm open, but don't need the cash.

Email me your number and I can text you more pics

Must be legal and show ID. I'm a private seller. CWP preferred.

FTF in Clermont area only. Must pick up near me, I can't drive to meet outside of Clermont due to family health issues, sorry.

Trade options at bottom of ad.


Thanx for looking......... 

I prefer to sell but if you have something that is a deal, I might consider it. 

Great condition guns only.  If your offering trade, you need to send me offer price and model and condition of your gun.  GUNS only!!  

I am not into inflated trade value prices.  I would use gunbroker or walmart pricing to value your trade.  I can just sell it and go there to buy cash but I like trading with reasonable people.

Main trade I'm looking for is an AR, nothing high end.  $500-1100 range.  Prefer factory built upper and lower from same company.  I have lots of different ammo I can add to trade and a little cash or can accept your trade plus cash.

others
Prefer Gen 3 or Gen 4 Glocks $400-$550 range plus cash
Maybe a Judge or a Govenor. 
Possibly an M&P AR 22 or HK 416.
Sig P238 or P938
1911's
Higher end Tactical Shotgun plus cash
Possibly other tactical weapons plus or minus cash. No old beat up guns please.
Home defense Gun's .38, .380, 9mm, 40 or 45 cal 

For all trades other than AR 15 or AR 10, I will only add ammo to trades.......

But throw anything my way, I'm interested in anything that is in great to new condition that functions perfectly.  

Thank you for reading this ............

title: For Trade:  1939 7.35 Carcano "Fucile Corto" for TRADE
postcontent:
Hi,

I will post pictures soon. I have a 1939 Carcano rifle, and it is chambered for the semi-rare 7.35 round. I have never fired the rifle, but know some of its history. It was returned to my grandfather after WWII by his brother, who was an MP. The rifle has some very unique stamping on it.

It was manufactured in Terni, Italy.
It has the roman numeral count to mark its production during that year of Mussolini's reign.
It has "SA" marked on it, which means that it was given to the Royal Finnish army to defend from invading Russians.
It also has the original sling.

I do not have a stripper clip for it, and cosmetically it looks great aside from a small wooden chip in the top of the rifle.

title: Want To Buy:  Want to buy a quality AR-15 / M4
postcontent:
I'm looking to buy a quality AR-15 or AK-47 and I'm sort of picky as to what I want. I know exactly what I'm looking for, I just need a FAIR price.
Acceptable Brands: 

- Older model Bushmasters with either a flat top or detachable carry handle (XM-15 A-3 or A-4), M-4 profile barrel. , NO NEWER BUSHMASTERS PLEASE. unless it's a Carbon-15 flat top

- Bushmaster Carbon-15's

- Colt LE or SP models with either flat top or detach carry handle, M-4 profile barrel

- WHINDHAM M-4 flat top 

- STAG ARMS MODEL 1 or 2

- Sig M400 or M400 Enhanced,

- CMMG carbines, Daniel Defense carbines, Mossberg, S&W or other reputable brands that I don't know of or can't think of at the moment.

I DO NOT want DPMS, ATI OMNI, or any other lower end models. I want to get this right the first time as I don't have the money or patience for major repairs.
Would like 5.56/.223 or 7.62x39
I'm also open to newer, more modern AK-47's but must have quad-rail fore grip and weaver/piccatinny flat top rail for mounting optics. No wood stocks.

I am open to NEW OR USED offers, but rifle must be Mil-Spec from muzzle to butt stock, be in excellent running condition,( I'm not overly concerned with minor exterior scratches or damage ), have either a 1:7 or 1:9 twist, chrome lined barrel and preferably M-4 feed ramps. Gas piston or direct impingement; either is fine.
No polymer lowers.
I cannot afford any type of free floating barrel system.
I'm sorry but I warned you I am picky, This will be my first AR-15 but I've done some homework and I know what I want.
Thanks for looking
Please send offers and pictures to my email: REDACTED

Tactical Riot Shield - Full Size w/ Handle
This is the same type of riot shield used by many police departments as part of their anti-riot gear. Made by a GSA Compliant manufacturer, the only difference between this shield and the shield our manufacturer sells to police departments is the lack of a blue/silver "POLICE" banner on the front.

title: For Sale:  PSL Rifle,200rds,3mags,hard case,sling,scope
postcontent:
The time has come to sell my guns, my wife is having a baby and we need the money. This is my prized possession but i need to part ways with it. I have owned 2 PSLs and this one is in close to factory condition. I am the second owner of the rifle, the first owner said he never got a chance to shoot it besides the week he bought it because he worked on an airline and was always traveling. I have only put about 200 rounds through it, i bought a case of 440 and got about 200 left. When I go to the range I usually spend more time explaining what the gun is and letting people shoot it a couple times, it draws a crowd every time I go. I have only shot light ball 147 grain through it. I did take it out to a range up to 600 yards and after a couple shots adjusting my scope I was nailing the target every time. Whenever I've shot it I've never shot more than 30 rounds at a time before cleaning it. I haven't shot it for about a year but get it out every once in a while just check it out and oil it up. The rifle is still close to new condition, the parts still fit very tight on it and the guns finish still has little marks.
*Will split shipping to a FFL anywhere in the US*
*All matching numbers including magazine*
*Can send more pictures and information upon request*
